column4: What's a better search tool than the gnome-search-tool? i.e. one that will search hidden files/folders? And is there one that is similar to the command "locate", where it can search thru a database of your files?
there should be an option "Show hidden and backup files"
Yes, but even when I enable that, it still won't search in my .folders.
:/ you're right
Must be a bug. Wish they would fix it!
I think tracker has an option to handle that, but I don't know for sure (not running it right now)
Yes, trident523 recommended tracker, I'm going to give it a try.
trident523, I just got gnome to search it!
give me a sec to nail down which option it was
okay, open the places | search
select more options | and select show hidden and backup files.  And then (important!) hit the add button :p
got that?
Yes, and I could swear I hit the "add" button originally, but I guess not, because I just tried it again. Thanks for finding my mistake! :)
that's fine, I did exactly the same thing :p
by default, it doesn't search across file systems
there's another option to enable searching across filesystems
It unfortunately does I think, because if I search at root level / then it finds the mounted partition in /mnt/hda1. Correct?
which, gnome search?
Just the Places > Search for Files (the gnome-search-tool)
by default, locate doesn't include anything in /media, and the gnome tool doesn't cross device boundaries by default
in gconf-editor, apps | gnome-search, you can specifically blacklist dirs, but I don't think it's needed
OK, I see it in the gconf-editor. Thanks for clarifying that. :)
